title: 107_s1129
content: PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH. The Executive Schedule pay rates are adjusted annually based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. The adjustment is rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions is adjusted annually based on General Schedule comparability payments in the District of Columbia. The adjustment is rounded to the nearest multiple of $100, with adjustments under subsection (a) taking precedence if scheduled for the same date. The adjusted rate of pay is treated as the official rate for the positions, unless specified otherwise by law. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions is adjusted annually based on General Schedule comparability payments in the District of Columbia. Adjustments under subsection (a) take precedence if scheduled for the same date. The adjusted rate of pay is treated as the official rate for the positions, unless specified otherwise by law. Amendments to Section 5372a of title 5, United States Code, ensure that Contract appeals board members receive no less than 97 percent of the adjusted rate. Amendments to Section 5372a of title 5, United States Code, guarantee that contract appeals board members will receive no less than 97 percent of the adjusted rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions. Amendments to Section 5372a of title 5, United States Code ensure that contract appeals board members will receive a pay adjustment in line with the General Schedule rates. Amendments to certain provisions in title 5, United States Code exclude executive schedule comparability adjustments in various sections. Amendments to provisions in title 5, United States Code exclude executive schedule comparability adjustments and limit certain payments for specific categories of employees. Amendments to sections 5372a, 5376, and 5383 of title 5, United States Code, involve substituting the Vice President's salary for level I of the Executive Schedule. References to level IV of the Executive Schedule are changed to level III in various sections. SEC. 2. PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE JUDICIAL BRANCH. Increase in Maximum Rates of Basic Pay Allowable for positions covered by section 604(a)(5) of title 28, United States Code, circuit executives, and personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts. The text discusses amendments to the Executive Schedule pay rates for personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts, changing levels from V to IV and IV to III. Amendments are made to the Executive Schedule pay rates for personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts, changing levels from V to IV and IV to III. Additionally, the salary of the Director of the Administrative Office of the United States Courts is adjusted from "district" to "circuit". The amendments made by this Act will be effective for pay periods starting on or after the enactment date.
